Background.text:
Ebullism syndrome, also known as ebullism or boiling blood syndrome, can occur if the ambient pressure is less than the vapor pressure ot normal body temperature. The condition is not remedied with O2 prebreathing as it occurs due to the formation of the gas phase of water due to lack of ambient pressure (vacuum).
Venous return can be obstructed due to bubble formation obstructing the venae cavae
[1]
One human exposed to a near vacuum for 5 minutes required multiple hyperbaric oxygen treatments and two chest tubes, but did recover fully
[2]

Muscle weakness and fatigue
Skin rash or lesions
Respiratory distress
Cardiac arrhythmias
Numbness, tingling, and confusion

Management.text: Based soley on case reports, treatment involves symptom control, immediate return to re-pressurization, and for severe symptoms, hyperbaric oxygen.
